text: Pope Julius II (; December 5, 1443 - February 21, 1513), born Giuliano della Rovere, was an Italian priest of the Roman Catholic Church and the 217th Pope from 1503 until his death in 1513. "List of Popes," Catholic Encyclopedia (2009); retrieved 2011-11-9. He was known as "the Warrior Pope."Schaff, Philip et al. (1910). "Julius II," History of the Christian Church, Volume 5, Part 2, p. 466. He was the nephew of Pope Sixtus IV.Society for the Diffusion of Useful Knowledge. (1839). "Julius II," Penny cyclopaedia, Vol. 13, p. 146. ==Early life == Giuliano della Rovere was the son of Rafaello della Rovere."Pope Julius II," Catholic Encyclopedia; retrieved 2011-11-9. His uncle would become Pope Sixtus IV. ==Cardinal== In 1471, Sixtus made Rovere a cardinal. ==Pope== Rovere was elected pope in 1503; and he chose to be called Julius II. Pope Julius was involved in Italian and European political disputes. In 1506, Pope Julius he established the Swiss Guard.
